p: Another important factor related to the high sensitivity of RIDTs in Japan was the measure used to collect samples for RIDTs. In our study, nasopharyngeal swabs were used as samples for all tests. In contrast, in the meta-analysis report, nasopharyngeal swabs or aspirate were used as test samples for <44% of tests [ 9]. The IDSA guidelines emphasize that nasopharyngeal specimens should be collected rather than other upper respiratory tract specimens in order to increase the detection of influenza [ 18].
